reasoning: Q1 revenue declined 1.4% year over year and 0.4% sequentially, with pressure from one large client and lower PSA revenue yield despite some offsets.
Adjusted EBITDA of $142.1M had margin of 61.4%, down 120 bps YoY but up 40 bps sequentially and slightly above internal expectations.
Operating cash flow and levered FCF were uses of cash, leverage remains high at 8.1x after refinancing, and cash balance is modest at $23.1M.
Pipeline expanded 127% QoQ, average ACV rose 35%, win rate climbed 32%, and roughly half the funnel is white space at existing clients.
Three-year renewal with largest client and a five-year $13M ACV renewal with a top-20 client underscore 98.6% NRR and support guidance.
Payment & Revenue Integrity revenue grew 9.7% YoY and 11.5% QoQ, hitting the highest quarter since 2Q22 and labeled a business highlight.
OCI migration is showing 4–7x performance gains and a new cloud ERP went live, expected to lower TCO and improve scalability and analytics.
CompleteView traction, 100+ leads from Becker’s, growing provider client base, and planned ‘Vitality’ quality reporting suggest momentum.
VDHP is the largest segment of the 2025 active pipeline; integration of ACE and a new broker model are designed to accelerate revenue.
MOU with Burjeel/Virgil targets GCC markets with US-style coding; leadership expects initial revenue this year and sees strong fit, though early-stage.
New growth org, sales kickoff, 13 new sellers, and structured roles (BD, client success, new markets) improve go-to-market discipline.
Channel partnership enhances VDHP and BEN Insights with specialty care navigation; revenue-sharing model expands reach with limited incremental cost.
Management frames rising healthcare costs and transparency mandates as tailwinds for Claritev’s analytics and cost-reduction capabilities.
